wikipedia_page.main: Captain Thomas Frederick Le Mesurier DSC & Two Bars (6 February 1897 – 26 May 1918) was a British flying ace of the First World War credited with seven aerial victories. Le Mesurier was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross (DSC) and Two Bars for his conspicuous service in bombing operations.

response: *Thomas Le Mesurier, served in the Royal Air Force during World War I as a flying ace credited with seven aerial victories. Awarded DSC twice in 1917 and in 1918
Thomas Le Mesurier may refer to:
* Thomas Le Mesurier (priest, born 1756) (1756–1822), British lawyer, cleric and polemicist
* Thomas Le Mesurier (RAF officer) (1897–1918), World War I flying ace
* Thomas Le Mesurier (priest, born 1785) (1785–1864), Anglican priest, Archdeacon of Malta

link_mentions.page: List of people from the London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham
response: * Thomas Le Mesurier, flying ace of World War I, born in Shepherd's Bush.
